channel.title: Ultima Thule Ambient Music
channel.description: A weekly programme of ambient and atmospheric music from across the ages and around the world, heard on Australian public radio since 1989. Ultima Thule weaves a mix of ambient, trance, drone and chillout electronica, spacemusic, ancient, mediaeval and neoclassical creations, traditional and world music, soundtracks, cool jazz and impressionist soundworks into an exquisite, chatter-free 90-minute musical narrative.
channel.itunes:author: George Cruickshank
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ambient and atmospheric music from across the ages and around the world.
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly programme of ambient and atmospheric music from across the ages and around the world, heard on Australian public radio since 1989. Ultima Thule weaves a mix of ambient, trance, drone and chillout electronica, spacemusic, ancient, mediaeval and neoclassical creations, traditional and world music, soundtracks, cool jazz and impressionist soundworks into an exquisite, chatter-free 90-minute musical narrative.
channel.itunes:keywords: ambient, music, spacemusic, space music, new age, atmospheric, electronic, chill, dub, radio, musica

item.title: UT 853

item.title: UT 792

item.title: UT 791

item.title: UT 790

item.title: UT 789

item.title: UT 788

item.title: UT 787
item.description: A beautiful intruder slips through the door; showcasing the collaborative works of Harold Budd and Clive Wright. Also featured are Dead Can Dance, Evan Marc and Stephan Micus.

item.title: UT 786

item.title: UT 785

item.title: UT 784
item.description: Another visit to the world of contemporary Japanese ambient, by way of Juta Takahashi.

item.title: UT 783

item.title: UT 782

item.title: UT 781

item.title: UT 780
item.description: Two new albums born of glacial environments, by Kalte and Lull.

item.title: UT 779
item.description: Streams of thought in imagined realities; new sounds from Steve Roach, Bruno Sanfilippo, Human Metronome and 33 Tetragammon.

item.title: UT 778

item.title: UT 777

item.title: UT 776
item.description: Overdosing on analogue; new music with old sounds, by Fanger and Schonwalder, Wayne Huff and Something Completely Different.

item.title: UT 775
item.description: The universe inside our soul; exploring the deep sky music of Robert Carty.

item.title: UT 774
item.description: New sonic constructivism from Bionulor, Aqua Dorsa, Longing For Orpheus, Nitin Sawhney and Bob Holroyd.

item.title: UT 773
item.description: The lucidity of bliss; compilation releases on the One World Music label, with works by Alucidnation, Tom Middleton, Sola Luna and Kaya Project.

item.title: UT 772
item.description: Inward journeys to outward places; music by Rabindranath Tagore, David Parsons and L Subramaniam... and featuring "Vayu: The Gathering of Winds", from Mother Sky.

item.title: UT 771
item.description: Into the lair of the Minotaur; new music from Between Interval.

item.title: UT 770
item.description: Infinite intangibilities from Vicki Hansen, Eucalyptus Dream, Ryuta K, Sara Ayers, Chad Kettering and Michael Stearns.

item.title: UT 769
item.description: Jon Shapiro lands on planet Ultima Thule with 90 minutes of ambient psychedelia from the 1960s, 70s and 80s, by Philip Glass, Walter Carlos, the Beatles, Pink Floyd, the Electric Prunes, Mike Oldfield and Tangerine Dream. Freak out!

item.title: UT 768
item.description: Ambient impressionism, with Stefan Tischler, Richard Bone, Peter Miller and John Kilbey... and featuring "The Light", new from UtopiaXO.

item.title: UT 767
item.description: Living esoterically with Robert Carty and Dan Pound.

item.title: UT 766
item.description: As the wurm turns; glacially-inspired earthsounds from Between Interval, Oophoi and Alio Die.

item.title: UT 765
item.description: The second installment of our periodic exploration of the trance-endental catalogue of Lyon-based Ultimae Records.

item.title: UT 764
item.description: As Brian Eno arrives in Sydney as curator the inaugural "Luminous" festival, we revisit his early ambient releases, including collaborations with Daniel Lanois and Laraaji. Jon Hopkins rounds out the mix.

item.title: UT 763
item.description: Lunar waxings and wanings in a house of mirrors; surreal nighttime excursions with Jon Hassell, Stephan Micus and the recently-deceased Hector Zazou.

item.title: UT 762
item.description: Inspired by high places from the Himalayas to the Andes comes rarefied music from Vangelis and Bruno Sanfilippo.

item.title: UT 761
item.description: Magellanic skies; new music from Altus, Uriel and Ernst Kunst.

item.title: UT 760
item.description: Presenting a languid selection of new and recent releases by Philippe Emmanuel Gueble, Minus 6, Dan Pound and Janne Hanhisuanto.

item.title: UT 759
item.description: Singing for lost blossoms, and celebrating ambient intelligence: new music by Harold Budd, Clive Wright and Peter Challoner. Also included is Thorsten Sudler-Mainz.

item.title: UT 758
item.description: An introduction to the globally-inspired soundworld of British composer Bob Holroyd - leavened with likeminded creations from Paolo Modugno and Guy Bouliane.

item.title: UT 757
item.description: A subcontinental riverine journey, from the mountains to the sea, with the sounds of Shiv Kumar Sharma, Har Prasad Chaurasia and Zakir Hussain.

item.title: UT 756
item.description: Ultima goes Ultimae; selections from the Farenheit Project compilation series released by French label Ultimae Records.

item.title: UT 755
item.description: Cool excursions for travellers, with General Fuzz, Altus and Panoramaroid.

item.title: UT 754
item.description: Stepping through the portal, with Craig Padilla, Zero Ohms, Skip Murphy, Derek Jones and Giles Reaves.

item.title: UT 753
item.description: Sibyls, saints, sinners and seraphim; a visit to the magical mystical musical (not to mention comically alliterative) universe of sometime Dead Can Dancers Lisa Gerrard and Brendan Perry.

item.title: UT 752
item.description: Eno-esque ambient from the Land of the Rising Sun, featuring the work of Yoshio Ojima and Juta Takahashi.

item.title: UT 751
item.description: Synthaesthesia from the keyboards of Michel van Osenbruggen, David Wright and Robert Fox... and featuring new music from the god of synths: Vangelis.

item.title: UT 750
item.description: Ambient minimalism from Australia, featuring Peters Miller and Ball.

item.title: UT 749
item.description: Vox ambienta... featuring songsters Jan Garbarek, Stephan Micus, Dean de Benedictis, Lee Ellen Shoemaker, Barry Truax, Diatonis, Boris Feoktistov and Eden.

item.title: UT 748
item.description: Vox ambienta... featuring songsters Jan Garbarek, Stephan Micus, Dean de Benedictis, Lee Ellen Shoemaker, Barry Truax, Diatonis, Boris Feoktistov and Eden.

item.title: UT 747
item.description: Dipping a toe in the kinetic flow, with Rudy Adrian and Thom Brennan... and also presenting Numina live in concert.

item.title: UT 746
item.description: Happy birthday to us! Today - 1 February 2009 - UT enters its third decade as one of the foremost ambient music radio shows on the planet; helping us kick off our year-long anniversary celebrations are the uber-cool ambient now-sounds of Charlie North, Si-O and The Glimmer Room. Turn on, tune in, chill out.

item.title: UT 745

item.title: UT 744
item.description: Passing beyond the gateway to a desert realm whose denizens include Numina, Tera Ambient, Steve Roach, Kevin Braheny, Bruno Sanfilippo and Rudy Adrian.

item.title: UT 743
item.description: Slow arrivals and sudden departures from Johan Agebjorn, Richard Bone, Stephan Kaske and Kees Aerts.

item.title: UT 742

item.title: UT 741
item.description: From speech to speechlessness, as Pitch Black is lost in translation.

item.title: UT 740

item.title: UT 739

Sydney DJ Marc "Kundalini" Cottee will be taking Mike's place in the UT lineup from October. Be sure to make him welcome.

item.title: UT 604
item.description: Electric Ladder and other ambient geometries; showcasing the new album from Robert Rich.

item.description: Possible musics from the Fripp - Eno - Hassell creative nexus.

item.title: UT 550

item.title: UT 549
item.description: A world of new electronic sounds showcasing The Orb, Hallucinogen and Gabriel Le Mar.

item.title: UT 547
item.description: Together: A Pärt. Neo-mediaeval meditations from Estonia.

item.title: UT 546
item.description: The distractions of abstraction. With Satsuki Shibano & Yoshio Ojima, Lawrence English and Stephan Micus.

item.title: UT 545
item.description: Surfing the Waveform.

item.title: UT 544
item.description: Rare Easter ambience from Peter Kuhlman - better known as Pete Namlook - along with complementary offerings from Zone, The Glimmer Room and Software.

item.description: A special broadcast showcasing the soundtrack to "Alexander" along with a few other gems from the keyboards of Vangelis.

item.description: A convergence of evolving visions, showcasing Mantram, the hypnotic new album from Steve Roach, Byron Metcalf and Mark Seelig.

item.description: Ambient Glassworks, from the 20th Century's leading minimalist composer.

item.title: UT 538
item.description: From the deserts of the US midwest to the forests of Scandinavia; with sounds from Steve Roach and Roger King, A Small, Good Thing, Inga Liljestrom and Wendy Rule.

item.title: UT 537
item.description: A special programme of home-grown Australasian ambience.

item.title: UT 536
item.description: Lush, enticing electroscapes from the masterful hands of Thom Brennan, Robert Scott Thompson and Steve Roach.

item.title: UT 535

item.description: A New Year excursion into Vedic sounds and deep psychedelic space with David Parsons, Infinity Project, Pete Namlook and Dr Atmo.

item.description: Sounds for exotic lounging, featuring Galaxy, Steff, Ornament and more.

item.description: Classic German electronica from Johannes Schmoelling, Conrad Schnitzler, Peter Baumann and Tangerine Dream.

item.description: Ambient impressionism, from Harold Budd, Peter Ball, Bruno Sanfilippo and Brannan Lane.

item.description: Dreams and nightmares, courtesy of Peter Miller, Patrick Mimran, Lustmord, Steve Roach, Amir Baghiri, Richard Bone and others of their ilk.

item.description: Nev Dorrington explores the work of German electronic music pioneer Klaus Schulze.

item.title: UT 520
item.description: Vale Michael Garrison.

item.title: UT 519
item.description: Music by Lisa Gerrard and friends. Featuring selections from "Gladiator", "Whalerider" and "Immortal Memory".

item.description: Into the darkness; out of the light. With music by Robert Scott Thompson, Diatonis, Robert Rich, Brian Lustmord and Numina.

item.description: The art of the seamless segue, featuring global beats, ambient entrancements and neo-classical sounds from Hallucinogen, Loop Guru, Laurel, Entheogenic, Popul Vuh, Max Richter and co.

item.title: UT 518
item.description: Into the darkness; out of the light. With music by Robert Scott Thompson, Diatonis, Robert Rich, Brian Lustmord and Numina.

item.title: UT 517
item.description: The art of the seamless segue, featuring global beats, ambient entrancements and neo-classical sounds from Hallucinogen, Loop Guru, Laurel, Entheogenic, Popul Vuh, Max Richter and co.

item.title: UT 516
item.description: A passage to India, by way of Ghazal, Ravi Shankar and friends, and other leading exponents of the traditional music of the subcontinent.

item.title: UT 515
item.description: As wild storms hit Sydney, it seems that Robert Rich has indeed been successful in "Calling Down the Sky".

item.title: UT 514
item.description: Chilled sounds from Europe, with Luis Junior, Solar Quest and Exergonic.

item.title: UT 513
item.description: Mike G cooks up a steaming midwinter mix of ambient trance, psychedelic dub, ambient pop and deep spacemusic.

item.title: UT 512
item.description: Into the lair of the serpent, with Steve Roach and Byron Metcalfe.

item.title: UT 511
item.description: Loreena McKennitt and others help drive the cold winter away.

item.title: UT 510
item.description: A journey to the Roof of the World, from Yungchen Lhamo, Lama Gyurme and David Parsons.

item.title: UT 509
item.description: A languid Mike G mix of lightly-chilled sounds, featuring New Composers, Ulrich Schnauss, Alpha Wave Movement, Thought Guild and Vangelis, amongst others.

item.title: UT 508
item.description: Midwinter atmospherics from Tear Ceremony, Amir Baghiri, Brannan Lane, Kent Sparling and Igneous Flame.

item.title: UT 507
item.description: The mystic chords and sacred spaces of Steve Roach's expansive sonic universe.

item.title: UT 506
item.description: Voices from the aether. With sounds from Sarband, Sinfonye, Lisa Gerrard, Patrick Cassidy and Dead Can Dance.

item.title: UT 505
item.description: Sonic adventures in the domain of the sirens, with Future Sound of London, Jon Mark, Union Jack and Mychael Danna amongst others.

item.title: UT 504
item.description: Music for late night musing, featuring Jeff Greinke, Paul Schutze, Numina, Kelly David, Brannan Lane, Ashera, Cheer Up Poems and Dan Barrio.

item.title: UT 503
item.description: A special programme of unreleased music from the master of Himalayan ambience, David Parsons.

item.title: UT 502
item.description: A tapestry of song, with Tori Amos, Kate Bush, Clannad, Adiemus, Libera, Magna Canta, Lesiem, Era and Vangelis amongst others.

item.title: UT 501

item.title: UT 500
item.description: The half-millennium broadcast, featuring rare, unreleased music by composers living and working in Australia, drawn from the Ultima Thule archives.

item.title: UT 499
item.description: Dates and conditions by Jean Michel Jarre, Brian Eno and Peter Schwalm.

item.title: UT 498
item.description: Vital sequences and numinous transcensions. With music by Steve Roach, Numina and Thom Brennan.

item.title: UT 497
item.description: New ambient sounds from near and far.

item.title: UT 496
item.description: Nocturnal transmissions. Featuring Amir Baghiri, Suspended Memories and Steve Roach.

item.title: UT 495
item.description: Wolf Linz and Dom F Scab explore alternative unrealities.

item.title: UT 494

item.title: UT 493
item.description: An electronic pot pourri. Add one part Honeyroot, three parts Blu Mar Ten, and a sprinkling of Kinobe, Datar, Radium 88 and others. Simmer for 90 minutes. Enjoy.

item.title: UT 492
item.description: Lacrimae mundi. With Kronos Quartet, Paul Scott, Hildegard von Bingen, Arvo Part, Philip Glass and Henryck Gorecki.

item.title: UT 491
item.description: Electronic explorations from Dom Scab, Lance Lenehan, Raphael Preston and Mat Dickson.

item.title: UT 490
item.description: Gorgeous tonal narratives from Erik Wollo, John Flomer and Deborah Martin.

item.title: UT 489
item.description: Electronic contemplations, with Popul Vuh, Tim Story, Pete Namlook, Oliver Lieb, Dr Atmo and Cliff Martinez amongst others.

item.title: UT 488
item.description: Ambient music for strings. Featuring Kronos Quartet, Walter Fahndrich and Principle of Silence.

item.title: UT 487
item.description: A programme of surprising sounds from Russian label Electroshock Records.

item.title: UT 486
item.description: Who said you can't dance to ambience? Amanaska, Deep Forest, Transglobal Underground and the Tunnel Singer show us the way. Also featured is the latest from David Sylvian.

item.title: UT 485
item.description: A Mike G mix of instrumental hip hop, ambient techno, dub, trance and trippy lounge.

item.title: UT 484
item.description: The Gatherings. With music from Peter Baumann, The Ministry of Inside Things, Bionaut, Steve Roach, Robert Rich, Jeff Greinke and friends.

item.title: UT 483
item.description: The ninth and final broadcast in Nev Dorrington's Vangelis programme series. Featured are some early collaborations as well as rare unreleased pieces composed for television programmes, sporting events and operas.

item.title: UT 482
item.description: A programme of deep ambience that ranges from the sparse evocations of Brian Eno's seminal On Land to the lush impressionist narratives of Martin/Klamt/Rownd's "Convergence".

item.title: UT 481
item.description: Mike G launches Ultima Thule's 15th year with a programme of new and classic ambient electronica - including sounds from the much-anticipated, newly re-launched em:t label.

item.title: UT 480
item.description: Mystic Chords and Sacred Spaces - Ultima Thule ends 2003 with a journey through the complex inner worlds of Steve Roach and the vast, resonant Antarctic submarine environments of Craig Padilla.

item.title: UT 479
item.description: The collaborative works of Vangelis and Yes vocalist Jon Anderson comprise the eighth installment of Ultima Thule's ongoing Vangelis series.

item.title: UT 478
item.description: Music from and inspired by film. Featuring the Philip Glass soundtracks to "Koyaanisqatsi", "Powaqqatsi" and "Naqoyqatsi", and Richard Einhorn's "Voices of Light" oratorio, based on the 1928 silent masterpiece "The Passion of Joan of Arc".

item.title: UT 477
item.description: Chilled sounds for the modern world. Music released on the Em:t, Spirit Zone and Grand Central recording labels.

item.title: UT 476
item.description: Sounds from the landscape. Featuring "Forgotten Places" from James Johnson and Robert Scott Thompson, and "Enviro" by Ashera.

item.title: UT 475
item.description: The music of Vangelis, part seven. A programme of rare, unreleased pieces from "Missing", "Kavafy", "Frankenstein" and "Dragon".

item.title: UT 474
item.description: Chants, psalms, hymns and sagas; music ranging across the eastern christian traditions to the mediaeval Icelandic Eddas and the songs of the Provencal troubadors.

item.title: UT 473
item.description: Back to the source; German electronic music, from the 1970s through to today. Including Tangerine Dream, Neu, Popol Vuh, Pete Namlook and LSG.

item.title: UT 472
item.description: From the stepping stone to the portals, via a world of wonder; showcasing the exquisite electronic sound-pictures of Jon Jenkins, from his album "Flow".

item.title: UT 471
item.description: Part six of our ongoing Vangelis programme series. Collaborative works with vocalists Jon Anderson, Montserrat Caballe and Irene Papas are featured.

item.title: UT 470
item.description: Ambient electronica from David Parsons, Kaito, Global Communication and Mark Jenkins.

item.title: UT 469
item.description: Downtempo grooves and jazzy sounds featuring the Cinematic Orchestra, Amanaska, Red Snapper, and including a selection of tracks from German lounge label Stereo Deluxe.

item.title: UT 468
item.description: Crosscultural introspection with music from Estonia, England, Armenia and Tibet. Featuring Arvo Part, John Tavener, Michael Nyman and Peeter Vahi.

item.title: UT 467
item.description: The fifth programme in Nev Dorrington's ongoing Vangelis series showcases a selection of unreleased music from the soundtrack "1492: Conquest of Paradise".

item.title: UT 466
item.description: Music from Robert Rich, showcasing his latest recording "Temple of the Invisible".

item.title: UT 465
item.description: Classic electronic ambience, featuring Pink Floyd, Patrick O'Hearn, Michael Hoenig, Alpha Wave Movement and others.

item.title: UT 464
item.description: Jewels in the tonal narrative firmament. With sounds from Tim Story, Mychael Danna, John Serrie and Claire Fitch.

item.title: UT 463
item.description: The fourth of Nev Dorrington's Vangelis programme series. Featuring unreleased music from "Francesco" and "1492" amongst others.

item.title: UT 462
item.description: The subtleties of impressionistic electronic minimalism - with sounds by Jeff Greinke, Dan Barrio, Oophoi, Loren Nerell, David Sylvian and Holger Czukay.

item.title: UT 461
item.description: New electronic music from Australia and beyond. Featuring Coda, Sylken, Phaser, Amanaska, Telemetry Orchestra and others.

item.title: UT 460
item.description: Music to get lost inside of. With Bo Tomlyn, Steve Roach, Robert Rich,Michael Stearns, Amongst Myselves, Raphael and Ray Leonard.

item.title: UT 459
item.description: The third programme in Nev Dorrington's ongoing series on the music of Vangelis. Featured tonight is music from "Antarctica", "Soil Festivities", "Mask" and "Invisible Connections".

item.title: UT 458
item.description: An aural immersion experience ranging from West Africa to Russia by way of a few places that don't appear on any map. Featuring O Yuki Conjugate, Woob, Paolo Modugno and Boris Feoktistov.

item.title: UT 457
item.description: A science fiction adventure showcasing soundtrack music from "Solaris", "Blade Runner", "2001: A Space Odyssey" and "Dune".

item.title: UT 456
item.description: Celtic dreams and Himalayan contemplations - featuring Clannad, Enya, Sheila Chandra and David Parsons.

item.title: UT 455
item.description: The second instalment of an ongoing monthly series on the music of Vangelis. Featured this week are unreleased tracks from "Chariots of Fire" and "Blade Runner".

item.title: UT 454
item.description: Celebrations for voice and meditations for piano. With Talitha Mackenzie, Philip Glass, Alan Ginsberg, Galeshka Moravioff, and featuring Arvo Part's "Alina".

item.title: UT 453
item.description: Transcendent electronic sounds from The Orb, Carl Craig, Kruder and Dorfmeister, Speedy J, Tangerine Dream and others.

item.title: UT 452
item.description: Sacred sounds from the middle ages and modern times, featuring works by Magister Perotinus, Arvo Part, Jim Cole and David Hykes.

item.title: UT 451

item.title: UT 450

item.title: UT 449
item.description: An eclectic sonic adventure as Karl Craig, Anomalous Disturbances, Pete Namlook, Tim Story, Pink Floyd, Michael Stearns and the Leningrad Philharmonic rub shoulders.

item.title: UT 448
item.description: Showcasing new electronic impressionism from Richard Bone, Victor Cerullo and Amongst Myselves. Also featuring Harold Budd/Brian Eno and Thom Brennan.
